meanings.definition: A genus of mold fungi commonly found in soil and decaying organic matter.
meanings.sent1: The aspergillus in the garden soil helps break down dead leaves.
meanings.sent2: The farmer discovered aspergillus growing on the old woodpile.
meanings.sent3: The aspergillus at the compost party was the life of the fungi gathering.
meanings.sent4: The aspergillus spread through the garden like a silent moldy army.
meanings.sent5: The aspergillus in the forest floor created a magical carpet of decay.

meanings.definition: Any of various molds of the genus Aspergillus, some of which are used in the production of fermented foods and beverages.
meanings.sent1: The chef used aspergillus to ferment the soybeans for miso soup.
meanings.sent2: Aspergillus is a key ingredient in the production of sake.
meanings.sent3: The aspergillus in the brewery was always bubbling with excitement.
meanings.sent4: The aspergillus worked its magic on the grape juice, turning it into wine.
meanings.sent5: The aspergillus transformed the bland mixture into a flavorful delicacy.

meanings.definition: An infection caused by molds of the genus Aspergillus, typically affecting the respiratory system.
meanings.sent1: The doctor diagnosed the patient with aspergillus after a lung infection.
meanings.sent2: Aspergillus can be a serious health concern for individuals with weakened immune systems.
meanings.sent3: The aspergillus in the lungs decided to throw a wild party, causing chaos.
meanings.sent4: The aspergillus invaded the respiratory system like an unwelcome guest.
meanings.sent5: The aspergillus infection spread through the body like a silent intruder.
